Fields.DialogueText: Miss Somers. There you are. The crew told me you'd be up here. Wind's picking up - you should head down soon.
You all right there, Somers? I don't think you can stretch that spyglass any further. Is there something out there?
Somers?
... I'm sorry, Captain. The rascals down there are smoking, and they know how I feel about that. I'm going to go talk to them about this...
Let's cut them some slack. The battle with that Morgana was rough. They deserve a break and some relaxation - and they're not going against any regulations.
Captain, please. I will not allow any of the crew to fall ill because of something like smoking!
... Somers, I think this is the first time I've heard you raise your voice.

Fields.MenuText: Still, cut them some slack. You can give them, and me, a talking to in a while. Please don't make me beg here.
Let ‘em smoke. It'll do some good around here. I can feel morale dipping a bit.
My crew, my ship. We won the battle, and I'll be damned if I don't reward my crew. They're smoking, Captain's orders.

Fields.DialogueText: Okay, Captain. But you're all getting a mouthful later.
Fine, but just this once. I don't want them making a habit out of it.
... Aye, Captain. I need to make edits for my paper, anyway. I suggest not taking a peek at it.
Move out.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
"Captain allows crew to smoke poison. Soldiers lives continue to bob." Interesting headline in your gossip magazine there, Somers.
I told you not to peek at it. Still... what did you think?
There should be an apostrophe in "Soldiers'."
Oh, nuts. Fair enough.
Anything else?

Fields.MenuText: I have to say, you have a knack for this stuff. I hear it's keeping the morale high. Even mine, honestly. Keep it up.
Bumping gums and booshwash, I say. At least the crew's entertained.
I'd rather you not waste time with this, but I'll allow it.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain. It's fun being in the know on these things, and it keeps me up-to-date with the rest of the Belles.
Huh. You don't have to read it, you know...
Wasting time... and what exactly do you do during your down time, hm?
I enjoyed the section about our fallen soldiers. Who knew you could connect so well with them?
What do you mean, Captain?
I mean... I think it's nice, Somers. Not only are you our ship, but you have this strong connection with the crew as well. Keep it up.
Why, thank you, Captain. I'll do my best, as always.
Hey, Somers. Great paper this time, it sure beats getting my money taken by Anders.
Gambling has a tendency to have that sort of effect, Sylvia.
Are you going to come after all of us for gambling now?
Of course not, Captain. I think I'd enjoy taking some coins away from you.
Ha, very funny. You're on.
@BATTLE
Rough seas ahead, Captain.
Hey, what's going on? Somers?
I'm here. The way the sea roars and rocks... the dips and sways are growing bigger. Get the crew ready, Captain. The sea is angry.
You're right. The crew is getting sick left and right...
What are your orders, Captain?
Crew, gather yourselves. Cut the engines.
Wait, Captain. We need to ride this through. Keep our engines ahead one-third, no need to use much power. We brace ourselves, and we'll survive this.

Fields.MenuText: You know what? This may just work. Get ready.
Am I going to agree with this? I can't believe I'm going to agree with this.
This is ridiculous, Somers. You're crazy. We'll die out there.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain. Hold steady everyone.
You know, I can hardly believe it either. Hold steady.
Please don't doubt my sanity, nor my abilities. You know I can get us through this. It'll work, trust me.
Okay, let's do this.
*ALARM*
Well, isn't that just the cherry on top of this entire situation?
Don't worry, Captain. I have every confidence that we're up to the task.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Ready for a fight, Miss Somers?
I was made ready, Captain.
Good answer.
@BATTLE
Somers...
They're... they're gone. I just saw them topside just before the battle, but now...

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry, Somers. I know you cherish every member of this crew. Just know that they died honorably.
Somers... They lived and died as soldiers, we'll honor them as such.
The two of them knew what they signed up for. Don't waste time mourning. We have a war to win.

Fields.DialogueText: We'll need to have a proper sea burial and send letters to their loved ones.
They weren't just soldiers, Captain. They were people. They have families, friends, people who cared about them. And they'll be remembered as such.
I'll be over here in case you need me. In case you need to talk.
Duly noted, Captain... thank you.
Taking care with powder and explosives is about as important as it gets, yes.
I'm sure you all saw what happened to that Morgana's hull when we got lucky with fire that last battle. Blown wide open.
Certainly. We won't be seeing her for a while. Off into the fog she goes.
Watch it while I have this crate, pal. Coming through... One wrong move and... boom.
Oh no... excuse me? Hello?
Ladies and gentlemen, we now interrupt this safety talk for a proper safety demonstration.
Hello there?
... Ah boy. Ma'am?
Johnson, remember, both full and empty crates go below deck. Stack them three to a row, two inches between.
Tomorrow switch them around, and re-stack in a different order so they each get resting time at the top of the stack.

Fields.MenuText: Is all of that really necessary? As long as they're neatly stacked, it's fine, Miss Somers.
I think... you know what? I'll leave you to it.
Looks like someone'll be busy for a while. I like it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd rather not test our luck. I've added tons of flair to the warning signs around here. I'm making sure the rules are followed so we don't... go boom, as Johnson said.
Aye, Captain. Leave it to me.
Have to keep the ship in tip-top shape and safe, Captain.
If you mess it up, our friendly commander here will strike your next shore leave.
Aye aye.
@BATTLE
Don't let me interrupt your talk, Somers. I'm just passing through - and it sounds like the subject matter is important.
But we can keep that from happening to us with just a little bit of - oh, for heaven's sake.
*nods*
All hands on deck. Begin PMCS. It's time for maintenance.
Aye, Captain.
Preventative Maintenance Checks and Services is good to go.
Turrets?
Oiled up and unjammed, Captain. They're ready to fire when needed.
Roger that. How about the crew's quarters?
We have a group swabbing them as we speak. Every single inch will be up to regulations.
Good. What else we got?
Carolyn and Myers took a group to wipe down and clean the guns. Only five soldiers were injured in the last battle, thankfully. I'll have the medics take a look at them.
Other able-bodied seamen are currently awaiting orders.

Fields.MenuText: Let's get a crew inspecting the hull. It's taken a beating, and I want to make sure we don't have any structural problems.
Get eyes on the boiler room, make sure there are no cracks, dents, or marks anywhere in the area.
How's our radar? Our sonar? Any damage?

Fields.DialogueText: Good call. I'd rather not succumb to the depths of the sea anytime soon.
Boiler room is holding up just fine, but I agree, let's still have a three-man crew manning in the area.
A couple of cracks that can be replaced in a jiffy. Sonar should be available within the hour.
See to it.
Aye, Captain. Mind if I make a... personal request?
What kind of request?
Well... my wine... some of the bottles broke and made a leviathan of a mess in my quarters. I'd appreciate it if someone could clean it for me.
I can take care of that, ma'am.
Why, you're so sweet - thank you! Please make a list of which bottles broke, if you're able.
You and your admirers...
What? Jealous?
Just amused.
@BATTLE
And, honestly, it's well earned. Even by Belle standards, you're uncommonly devoted to your crew's well-being. The newspaper, the anti-smoking campaign, the-
Speaking of the anti-smoking campaign-
*ALARM*
Take that as a sign, Somers.
Ship ahead. At the edge of our range, to the north.
What sort of ship is that?
From the looks of things, I think it's a Morgana destroyer doubling as a supply ship. I just think it'd be a little fun to capture, is all. Take whatever's on their ship as prize of war.
I don't like the sound of this...

Fields.MenuText: Doesn't it sound like a trap to you?
Is that... is that a gleam in your eye? What are you planning?
There's no stopping you, is there?

Fields.DialogueText: I admire your concern - but, trust me, there are no Morganas outside of this dinky convoy for a hundred miles in every direction. If it's a trap, it's a silly one.
Just a little fun. Playing pranks on the other Belles can only entertain me for so long.
Not right now, at least.
At a flank bell, we can catch up to her in no time. Helm, all ahead flank-
Belay those orders.
But, Captain...
I just want to remind you before we start - this isn't about fun.
Isn't it, though? We give the crew an easy win, maybe let them get a few souvenirs, and see morale rise to new heights.
As long as we *do* win.
Have you *met* our crew?
... All engines ahead flank. Let's catch that ship.
@BATTLE
It's not like they have to feel bad about killing other people, Captain. It's okay to give them the occasional fight they can win and walk away from with their heads held high.
It always impresses me, the way the crew looks up to you, Somers.
You really think so? Shucks, Captain. Make a girl blush, why don't you?
Nothing you'll object to, I think. I was just going to say that you should disembark and stretch your legs next time we dock. The local civilians would love you - and you deserve the fresh air.
Hmm, that sounds pleasant, Captain. Show me a map? I want to figure out the nearby shops... do you think we could send a few crew members to a few stores beyond my range limit?
Within reason, I'm sure that could be arranged.
Thank you, Captain. I'm just thinking a department store, maybe a used bookstore or two. And maybe...
Hmm...

Fields.MenuText: Okay, spit it out, what are you thinking about?
Is there something else on your mind, Somers?
What? Are you sensing something nearby?

Fields.DialogueText: Blanquette de veau. A dish I've been craving from the French Rivera. You're definitely going to try it, Captain.
I've been craving blanquette de veau, something I had in the French Rivera.
Oh. No. I'm thinking about a dish... you know how much I love the French Rivera, right? Blanquette de veau is a meal I've been craving for a while now.
*ALARM*
We'll have to talk about it later. Let's go.
@BATTLE
And the way you can sway opinion? A true diplomat, you are.
Or are you just after something?
Heh.
*ALARM*
And, sorry, I was also sensing something nearby.
At least you have your priorities in order.
*ALARM*
Everyone, battle stations. Morganas - starboard. Somers! Get ready for this one, it'll be tough.
Aye, Captain. Multiple contacts off the beam.
Roger that. Point our turrets towards the closest raider. Get our mobile air defense systems armed and ready.

Fields.MenuText: All hands, listen up. Do not let down your guard. This Morgana is speedy, sneaky and intelligent. But us? We're speedier, sneakier and damn well smarter than she ever will be. Let's do it.
Crew? Show ‘em what we got.
Move out.

Fields.DialogueText: Great speech, Captain. I'm ready when you are.
Short and sweet, I like it.
... Let's move.
Eyes on target, ready to start shooting, Captain.
Ready!
Open fire!
@BATTLE
So... those dual pistols...
Ah, my babies.
Uh, sure... your babies. You're really good with those things. How do they fire?
They aren't for the faint of heart. The recoil will take you by surprise. I've actually been meaning to name them.
Ah, a nice tradition. Take your time with that. I've seen you in action.
What is it, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: You're just... impressive, Somers. You're always so fluid in action. Especially for, you know, a ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... thank you? I'll just say thank you.
Sorry... that sounded a bit odd, I'm sure. You're just quite the sight. Watching you and the crew take on Morganas... it's something else.
Well, I will happily take that compliment, Captain. That's kind of you to say.
In all candor, I'm angling to get a gun named after me.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Walking around with sidearms is dangerous.
You walking around with pistols is just... distracting in a way I didn't expect.

Fields.DialogueText: Our profession is dangerous, Captain.
Well, well, well... I guess you like my style.
Ha!
*ALARM*
All hands to battle stations! This is not a drill!
Eyes front, Somers. They're almost in range.
@BATTLE
Counting the spoils of the raid?
Could you try not to phase in with no warning? I nearly jumped out of my socks.
Aww, you're no fun. It's just a little prank. You should try to pull a few as well. They're invigorating. Great for morale, too!
Somers...

Fields.MenuText: I... I don't even know what to do with you sometimes.
The captain can't really pull pranks on the crew. It's just punching down.
Pranks, huh? I'll show you pranks. You just wait.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, let's keep it that way, okay? I like keeping you on your toes.
You're no fun. Fine, I'll go see what Thomas is up to...
Good luck with that, Cap.
... What is this, a war or a circus? Now, where was I? Boxes of tobacco... three for now, three down below. Hm... this pistol here is clean as a whistle...
... Wh... my hand. My hand's stuck to the gun. What the...?
SOMERS. I can hear you giggling.
... Hehehehe. That glue will wear off... eventually.
Say cheese!
No cameras! This is not going in your paper.
Morale, Captain! It humanizes you! The crew will love it!
*sigh*
Somers... what is that?
Oh, this?
Just an vintage dress I had one of the boys buy me the last time we were ashore. I thought I'd wear it sometime, liven up the dull grays around the ship.

Fields.MenuText: But what's with those... frilly things there?
I take your point. It's a nice color.
Please tell me you didn't make one of the sailors spend his own money.

Fields.DialogueText: Wow, Captain. Do you want to borrow some magazines? Maybe you should. I can't believe you called this fringe-hem frilly things.
Ha, thank you. It does make me happy, and I think the color suits me too.
No, no. It's all from my target shooting contest winnings!
Huh. You know...
*ALARM*
... Hold that thought. Full speed ahead. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Your what?
My babies aren't just for show, Captain. The crew enjoys-
You were going to say something like "a good show," weren't you?
Yes, yes. You're very clever. But it's true.
Hey, what's wrong? Something wrong with the ship?
No, it's not that, it's just...
Hey! That bit about the bombs in your article was a hit. Great job, Goldie.
Knutson, could I have a moment alone with Somers?
Captain! Of course - my apologies.
So, am I imagining things, or did you just wince when he called you "Goldie?"
The crew has taken to calling me that recently. I can't say it's my favorite nickname...

Fields.MenuText: You know it's meant affectionately. It matches you, in a good way. Look at your hair. It's gold.
Huh? Really, Goldie? There are worse nicknames. You should have heard some of the names I picked up when I was younger.
I can make it known that you want it to stop. Or that *I* want it to stop.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know... you think so? It's nice to know they think about me that much... giving me a nickname and all.
I can imagine a few possibilities...
Captain, if the crew doesn't respect me, asking them to hide it isn't going to help.
Remember, Somers, the crew knows you're one of them - the informality is actually proof of that. And they're proud as hell of you, as am I.
*ALARM*
You ready?
Aye, Captain. Thanks for the pep talk.
Don't mention it. Let's go.
@BATTLE
I'm sure it wasn't a wince. A twitch at worst.
Uh-huh.
Ha! Somers, I promise you, it's not about a lack of respect!
It's like... calling Babe Ruth "Babe." It's a sign of affection, not an insult. You're downright adored by this crew.
I don't know how you convinced them to turn around. Though, don't get me wrong, I'm mostly just glad it didn't involve shooting.
I mean, if you're crewing a merchant vessel out in all this, you want to trust the people looking out for you - it wasn't hard to make them see we had their best interests at heart.
The thing is, we spent a solid half hour begging them to turn back before the Morganas could intercept them. Then, you waltz in and convince them to turn around within seconds.
It's easy when you know how to talk to people. I just had to speak to them in words they could understand, appeal to their sensibilities. Child's play.

Fields.MenuText: Wow... you can be a little scary sometimes...
I guess I can understand that.
So... manipulation, basically?

Fields.DialogueText: It comes out to play at times, I'll admit.
Simple, right? You should try it out next time.
Well, when you say it like that...
Well, it worked. Thank you for your assistance, Somers.
I do what I can. We all have a variety of roles we can play in this war.
Indeed. Keep an ear on the radio room. And remind whoever's on shift to change frequency frequently, and keep on high alert.
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
... Uh-huh.
Confirmed, Captain. The civilian vessel is... just about clear.
Oh, it wasn't hard.
Okay, so, what's this?
This is our cooks' attempt at making one of my favorite dishes. A must have if we ever get to the French Riviera. It's called tapenade.
Are you sure? Coming from *our* galley?
Aren't you just hilarious? Still, you shouldn't make fun. The tapenade is an exquisite type of dish that can be served with a variety of foods.
Huh. Let me try a bite.

Fields.MenuText: Not bad! Let me try another bite.
Eh, it's... it's okay, I suppose, but I'll pass on any further helpings.
I've had better tapenade in my life.

Fields.DialogueText: Have all that you wish. There's plenty more where that came from.
Really? Well, that's a shame.
Why didn't you tell me you'd had it before?
*ALARM*
Morganas! On our tail, Captain.
Ah. Secure the plates. I'm not done with that meal.
Oh, really? Well, I'll pass your compliments on to our cooks.
@BATTLE
Hey, why don't we have a little gamble? A shooting contest, if you will.
Oh? Do you think you can out-shoot me, Captain? Not to be rude...
Just you and me, best out of say... five? What say you?
Ahh, my guns have been ready for a challenge. Let's give it a try.
Crew, place your bets. I have no doubts that you'll choose wisely.
Meaning you? We'll see about that. Line up the bottles.

Fields.MenuText: *Shoots, scores well*
*Shoots, misses several*
*Ties*

Fields.DialogueText: Well, well. I'm quite impressed, Captain. Looks like you're the leader of this ship for a reason.
Awww, isn't that a shame, Captain? Looks as if you could use some more practice. If you aren't a crack shot, at least you're attractive.
A tie, eh? Not too shabby, if I do say so myself.
How about a rematch? One more round.
*ALARM*
Or... not.
Later, then. For now, let's put those other guns of yours to good use.
@BATTLE
I can't believe I lost again.
You do seem to be suspiciously unlucky as far as your bets are concerned, Captain.
Another round?
You're on a losing streak, Captain. It might be best that you give it a rest.
... Ouch.
I'm just saying! And try not to bet on me any time soon. I don't want any of your bad luck to rub off on me.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, please, like that'll ever happen. Luck isn't real, anyway.
Come on, one more round.
There must be a limit to this bad luck. I am determined to find it.

Fields.DialogueText: Luck might not be, but a lack of luck certainly is.
Your funeral.
At the very least, your determination is admirable, Captain.
You sure you're ready?
Without a doubt.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Chill the champagne! And clear some space over there for people to line up, too. We have ourselves a photographer.
Wow. Check out that camera.
Whoa, what's this? It looks amazing in here. Are we really in the mess hall?
Yes, Captain! We're just getting ready to celebrate our next win. Everyone's been in a marvelous mood, so why not have a little party?

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like a great time. I like that idea. Maybe have me a nice highball...
A party, huh? All right fine, but none of the good stuff.
... I'd rather have a quiet, lights-out type of night.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, a classic? Nice choice, Captain.
Now's not the time to be Captain Stingy. We're gonna crack open the top shelf bottles.
Oh, don't be a grouch. You're allowed to have a drink and relax once in a blue moon.
Okay, I am officially signing off on Operation Fun.
That's the spirit!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hhph. We just need to make sure the band is playing a better song.
Captain?
... Hmmph.
Still feeling the effects of Operation Fun?

Fields.MenuText: I haven't ruled out the idea that I was poisoned.
Why... why are there two of you?
How... how could you let me eat so much?

Fields.DialogueText: Come on, Captain! The only way to get through the day is to face it head on.
Here, drink this water. You need to stay hydrated.
Could I have a medic come assist the Captain?
Okay. O... kay. I'm up, I'm alert. What's the time?
It's...
*ALARM*
Why? Ugh...
Sorry, Captain. Come on.
@BATTLE
*KNOCK*
Enter!
Hey, Captain. Are you busy?

Fields.MenuText: Not at all, Somers. What's on your mind?
Just contemplating future strategies. Come in.
A bit, but it can wait.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you. I won't take much of your time.
I'll be happy to discuss tactics afterwards.
I appreciate you taking the time. This won't be long.
Of course.
I've been on the lookout for this book, by Melville - my favorite author.
Moby Dick?
That's exactly it. You see, there's a rare gem out there... and even with all of my resources, I can't get my hands on it. A first edition.
I take it you need my help?
I mean, "need" is a strong word. But if you have any leads I could follow, I sure would appreciate it.
Well, I suppose I can contact a few people.
Really, Captain?
It's the least I can do.
Again?
Battle stations, Somers! Let's move.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You know I've been asking some of our crew members to visit bookstores for me when we reach port?
Right.
It means that much to you?
I know, it's silly. But I do like writing in general-
Hence the paper.
Hence the paper. And I like Moby Dick in particular. And... it would just be nice to have something special out here. Something new.
One of the propellers snagged something, Captain. Maybe a net. I'm giving the engines full reverse to see if I can get it it loose or cut it apart.
Aye, Somers.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Somers, come in.
I'm here.
Give me an update, and please make it a good one.
Somers?
Multiple casualties, Captain. Eighty injured, twenty-three currently confined to bed. A few of our systems will need repairs but... we made it. We survived.

Fields.MenuText: I can't believe we're alive. It could have been worse. Should have been worse.
I... how? Why so many...? I didn't think it would be that bad.
Those Morganas better not get in my sights again...

Fields.DialogueText: I agree, Captain... it's some kind of miracle.
I usually don't condone revenge but... but maybe just this once...
This will take time to heal... but I'm proud of everyone here. Our crew is strong, valiant. I'm honored to lead them.
You'll need to let them know that.
You're right. Let's get to it.
Somers, there you are. Have you been relaxing?
Yes, Captain. Just taking advantage of the small break we've had since that last battle.
I can't blame you. The sea is calm, skies are clear... for now.
It can change in a heartbeat. What was it that you needed?
Oh, right!

Fields.MenuText: I think you were looking for this, correct? A ratty old copy of Nancy Drew?
Ta da! A book about a whale or something. I think.
Here, this is for you. First edition and everything.

Fields.DialogueText: I was actually hoping for-- Ah! You were pulling my leg! This is a first edition copy of Moby Dick!
Ta da...? What... Captain! The book! A first edition of Moby Dick! How?
Captain, I can't believe it! A first edition of Moby Dick! Where did you ever find one?
The search was a little more involved than I anticipated. I sent inquiries, spoke with some other captains, and had a few Belles on the lookout.
Captain... this is the very edition that I wanted.
I almost gave up, honestly. But then the parcel arrived, the other day.
Captain... it's beautiful. It's even in pristine condition. Thank you, thank you, thank you.
The pleasure's all mine, Somers. You deserve it.
*ALARM*
All right, let's get a move on. Secure the novel, and take control of the weapons.
Aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All hands to stations! This is not a drill!
Somers, they know their jobs. Let's just get this done.
Damage control teams are standing by. Crews are manning their guns.
Very well, Anders. Excellent work.
I spot a few Morganas on their way.
Roger that. We'll give ‘em all we got.
One of them is slowing down.
Hm. What else do they have coming for us?

Fields.MenuText: Let's make a wide right turn, flank ‘em and confuse ‘em.
Get our main guns pounding. I want our five-inchers to flatten them.
Somers, what say you?

Fields.DialogueText: I prefer direct "communications" when I want to send a nasty message, Captain. But then again, that's just me.
Big guns are always in fashion, Captain.
Excessive firepower never goes out of style, if you ask me.
All right. Let's roll, Somers. Move out.
@BATTLE
I think they've spotted us - no need to be quiet anymore.
Somers, if you please? Ring the bell?
*ALARM*
Much appreciated.
@BATTLE
Ah, yes... this wine is exactly what I needed after that battle. Between this and knowing I have a good book waiting for me - heaven.
... I see the crew has already started to smoke.
I take it back about heaven. And I'm throwing those guys overboard.

Fields.MenuText: We can move if need be.
The crew is responsible, Somers. You know you can trust them.
Over my dead body.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you for your consideration, Captain.
Yes... I suppose I do.
Don't wish too hard for that, Captain.
... Let's just have a nice night, okay?
Here's another bottle, ma'am.
Thank you kindly. Let's have a toast, Captain.
Gladly.
My distinct pleasure, Captain!
"Belles continue to push forward, refusing to allow Morganas to gain the upper hand." Okay, I'm liking this one, Somers. It has a nice ring to it.
Thank you, Captain. It's always nice to write good news. I've seen nothing but smiles.
We do make a great team, don't we? You know, I've never once doubted my trust in you.
S-stop sweet talking me, Captain.
Careful, there. You may just need to phase out. You're starting to wobble in those fancy shoes of yours.
I don't wobble. I strut. I don't mean to be presumptuous, but you should really pay more attention.

Fields.MenuText: That girl... she's always got tricks up her sleeve. She's a damn good partner. Let's see what else she's got.
That girl... Somers. She really is something... someone... special.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Maybe I'll go refill my glass of wine.
